image.altText: Person getting arrested with handcuffs

props.synopsis: The Victorian government's bail reforms will become law, with the legislation passing both houses of parliament in a sitting that stretched late into last night.

title.children: Tougher bail laws to come into effect after marathon parliament sitting

image.altText: A photo of a power point at a wall with three black cords plugged in and the power turned on.

props.synopsis: The company behind a proposed new underground transmission line for Victoria says if it were to go ahead, it would delay the need to build two controversial projects.

title.children: 250km-long underground transmission line proposed for Victoria

image.altText: Two police cars are parked in the middle of a street which is taped off with police tape.

props.synopsis: A Victorian magistrate has extended a violent teenager's time behind bars, saying the community needs to be protected from the 15-year-old boy.

title.children: Community needs to be protected from violent 15yo boy, says magistrate

image.altText: A digital render of a train station at Melbourne Airport.

props.synopsis: The Federal government, state government and Melbourne Airport have signed a Memorandum of Understanding to commence delivery of the Airport Rail Link project but would not confirm a completion date.

title.children: MoU a 'significant' commitment to Melbourne Airport Rail Link, govt says

image.altText: Three Hawthorn AFL players celebrate a goal against the Blues.

props.synopsis: Undefeated through their opening three matches, the Hawks are not getting carried away with their start to the season, which continued with a gritty 20-point win over the Blues at the MCG.

title.children: 'Not our best performance': Hawks want improvement despite unbeaten start

image.altText: black and white horse with her mane braided

props.synopsis: A cherished therapy horse feared stolen from a Central Victorian property has been found unharmed by police.

title.children: Mystery of 'stolen' therapy horse Rosie solved

image.altText: Chimneys from Scarborough's Pluto gas facility with flames coming from them.

props.synopsis: Gas consumption in Australia is falling faster than anticipated, helping to avoid the risks of seasonal shortages in the next few years, according to energy commentators.

title.children: Looming gas crisis averted as Australian use plummets

image.altText: Eight books, including a picture book, and a manuscript arranged against a while wall and yellow floor.

props.synopsis: The winners of this year's Victorian Premier's Literary Awards have been announced, with the list dominated by independent presses and First Nations writers.

title.children: Growing up, Wanda got old dresses for Xmas. Her book about it just won $125k

image.altText: A small bowl of plain elbow pasta next to a red squeeze bottle.

props.synopsis: Parents say they are being lied to about the quality of food at childcare centres across the country. Some say they were promised in-house chefs but children were served "two-minute noodles".

title.children: Childcare centres feeding children for as little as 33 cents a meal

image.altText: A photo of Sol overlaid on a photo of a two bathroom stalls - one for women and one for men.

props.synopsis: With universities and sports stadiums installing gender-inclusive bathrooms, Australia is considering making changes to make it easier to do so. We unpack what the proposed changes would mean.

title.children: Australia considering making changes to build all-gender bathrooms

image.altText: GettyImages-2197719456

props.synopsis: Holly McNamara is set to play a starring role in Melbourne City's AFC Women's Champions League quarterfinal against Taiwanese club Taichung Blue Whale.

title.children: Rising Matildas talent talks 'huge emotional toll' of repeated ACLs

image.altText: The exterior of the Supreme Court of Victoria.

props.synopsis: Armed with knives and a cricket bat, two "delusional" teenagers with plans to take over Australia killed a defenceless mother in a frenzied rage, a Victorian court has been told.

title.children: Mother stabbed to death after teens hatched national takeover plan, court told

image.altText: A close up of a brown male wedge-tailed eagle.

props.synopsis: Aptly named, Storm the wedge-tailed eagle has been released back into the wild more than a year after being injured in wild weather in Victoria.

title.children: Storm the wedge-tailed eagle returns to skies after feather transplant

image.altText: Sam Lalor celebrates a Richmond AFL goal against Carlton.

props.synopsis: Naysayers may suggest Richmond's win over Carlton in round one was a fluke, but there was a method to the way the Tigers achieved the upset defeat.

title.children: How the Tigers pulled off one of the biggest AFL upsets in recent memory

image.altText: A man in a courtyard resting his arms on a broom

props.synopsis: The Real Estate Institute of Australia says tenants are under no legal obligation to hire a professional to tidy their rental garden or courtyard.

title.children: How tidy does your garden need to be at the end of a lease?

image.altText: Seb O Halloran

props.synopsis: The court was told the girl, who was 17 at the time, was acting in self-defence when she stabbed the Mildura man during an incident in 2023.

title.children: Tears of relief as teenage girl cleared of murder in Victoria

image.altText: A selfie of a woman smiling from above in activewear, with a blue sky behind her.

props.synopsis: Megan Waters balances her time between the fitness industry and sports media. The Warumungu/Yawuru woman was born and raised on Larrakia Country in Darwin and is a sports presenter, gym owner, and trainer and says her days are never the same, "which presents its challenges".

title.children: TV presenter Megan Waters on navigating her busiest period yet

image.altText: Victoria Police badge on an officer's arm.

props.synopsis: A regional Victorian mayor says reports of vigilantism in a small town are "terrifying" some residents after a man allegedly heavily beat a young teenager.

title.children: Police investigate reports petrol bomb thrown at teen in vigilante attack

image.altText: Generic image of hands holding eggs

props.synopsis: Avian influenza-affected birds, eggs and soil from an outbreak at Euroa are being disposed of more than 100 kilometres away at Rutherglen, in a decision described by locals as "absolutely crazy".

title.children: Anger over disposal of bird flu waste in outbreak-free Victorian town

image.altText: Pokies

props.synopsis: The state government is being urged to fast-track pokies carded play, used at Crown Casino, to all of Victoria's poker machine venues.

title.children: A trial to curb pokies losses is set to roll out in Victoria — not everyone's happy

image.altText: A crowd fills a town hall for a protest meeting.

props.synopsis: One north-east Victorian town is battling a renewable energy project while its neighbour has plans to go totally green, fuelling policy division ahead of the election.

title.children: Victorian town pledges to take fight against battery storage to election

image.altText: Deanna Coates eyes are seen in the rearview mirror of her car, with red car tail lights visible in front.

props.synopsis: While most of Australia is sleeping, more than 1 million workers are supporting the $174 billion night-time economy.

title.children: In the crisp night air, these workers toil in a 'hidden' workforce

image.altText: A man in a colourful shirt and black sunglasses kneels down in red sand

props.synopsis: The discovery of these skeletal remains rewrote Australia's history books. Decades later, they're at the centre of a court battle.

title.children: Reburials underway amid court challenge over thousands-year-old skeletons

image.altText: Jacinta Allan speaks into a microphone.

props.synopsis: Jacinta Allan says claims by an ousted police deputy commissioner that the government conspired to remove him and then-chief commissioner Shane Patton are "baseless" and "completely untrue".

title.children: Victorian premier rejects 'baseless' corruption claim by former senior cop

image.altText: A photo of a festival crowd in front of an outdoor stage during the daytime. There is confetti and lots of hands in the air.

props.synopsis: Good Life, a festival exclusively for teenagers that has previously been held in major cities across Australia, has announced it will not return this year.

title.children: Another Australian music festival announces 2025 pause due to rising costs

image.altText: Shannon Cox with a football in his hand.

props.synopsis: Former Collingwood player Shannon Cox pleads guilty in a Perth court to manslaughter over the crash in WA's outback in which two women, aged in their 80s, both died.

title.children: Former AFL player Shannon Cox admits killing women in car crash

image.altText: An orange and black Formula One car driving partially on the asphalt track, partially on gravel.

props.synopsis: A new rule implementing cooling systems for F1 drivers was introduced this year. Racing is hot work at the best of times, so how does the new rule help?

title.children: Formula 1 car cockpits can reach 60 degrees C, but science has solutions

image.altText: spry

props.synopsis: The Trump administration has declassified documents revealing the CIA investigated anonymous calls made to the US embassy in Canberra before and after president John F Kennedy's assassination.

title.children: ASIO wanted Canberra link to JFK murder probe kept secret

image.altText: Woman and man smiling in a selfie in front of the ocean.

props.synopsis: Matt Wright was camping at one of Victoria's most popular national parks when he was bitten by a tiger snake. More than two months later he hasn't fully recovered.

title.children: Within minutes of being bitten by a snake, Matt was struggling to breathe

image.altText: A crowd outside Victorian parliament gathered near the steps during the day.

props.synopsis: About 200 people have rallied on the steps of state parliament in protest against the government's contentious bail laws, urging it not to push ahead with the changes they say will will harm "generations of Victorian children".

title.children: 'A travesty': Protesters denounce Victoria's proposed bail changes outside parliament

props.synopsis: Once as high as 60 cents per kilowatt hour, solar feed-in tariffs are now as low as just a few cents for some. While 4 million households have rooftop solar, home battery storage systems sit at around 320,000 — but take-up has surged as the economics improve.

title.children: 'It's a scam': As solar feed-in tariffs plunge, battery demand surges

image.altText: Generic AFP Badge

props.synopsis: The 41-year-old Victorian man is charged with allegedly making death threats and antisemitic comments to a federal MP.

title.children: Man charged over alleged death threats, antisemitic abuse against federal MP

image.altText: A woman wearing a white top, sunglasses and red hair leaves Ringwood Magistrates' Court.

props.synopsis: A Melbourne woman retrieved a dead man's toes from an animal shelter bin, thinking it was "cool" and that she could sell them online for $400, a court has heard.

title.children: Woman narrowly avoids jail after plotting to sell dead man's toes online

image.altText: Bounty offer letter for Kevin Yam

props.synopsis: The federal government has lodged diplomatic protests with China after two prominent Hong Kong activists in Australia were targeted in what appear to be coordinated intimidation campaigns.

title.children: Melbourne residents receive 'wanted' letter for Hong Kong pro-democracy activist

image.altText: Two ladies in hijabs, one in lilac and the other in burgundy, smile for the camera.

props.synopsis: After once worshipping in a house, a growing Muslim community celebrates opening the first mosque in its shire where "anyone who wants to come" is welcome.

title.children: Growing Muslim community celebrates shire's first mosque
